key_title: Key to the species of Cassytha

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Lauraceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Lauraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Lauraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant pubescent at least on inflorescence, often ascending to several metres high, with stout stems; flowers in spikes
Plant completely glabrous, low-growing, with slender stems; flowers in shortly pedunculate umbellate clusters
Flower buds covered by mostly brown or reddish hairs; mature stems to 1.5 mm thick, often pubescent; mature fruit pubescent, sometimes ribbed, 5–9 mm diam
Flower buds covered by mostly black hairs; mature stems to 4 mm thick, glabrous; mature fruit glabrous, smooth, often streaked blackish, c. 1 cm diam. or more
Spikes loose, mostly greater than 26 mm long; fruit ribbed, obovoid or pyriform, reddish-pubescent
Spikes congested, less than 26 mm long; fruit smooth, ovoid or globular, white-pubescent
